Banks, including Bank of America, cannot and do not provide personal account or address information to the IRS.
Those who do not have direct deposit set up with the IRS will receive paper checks in the mail, at the address that the IRS has on file.
For most of the recipients, payments will be deposited directly into the same bank account that they have most recently used to receive a tax refund or monthly Social Security payment.
Stimulus payments will be sent in waves over the course of multiple weeks into July 2020. Note: the IRS is responsible for the timing, amount and distribution of these payments.
